title: How to View MP4 Videos on an iPhone or iPad (4 Free Options)

steps.title: Yes, MP4 is compatible with iPhone and iPad.
steps.content: Yes, MP4 is compatible with iPhone and iPad. MP4 is one of the most common video formats, and it’s closely related to the QuickTime format, which was created by Apple. Your iOS devices should have no trouble opening and playing MP4s, either with native apps like Files or Photos, or with third-party media players like VLC. There’s no need to convert your files to another format before viewing them.

steps.title: Save an MP4 to your device’s storage or upload it to iCloud.
steps.content: Save an MP4 to your device’s storage or upload it to iCloud. There are several ways you can transfer an MP4 file to your iPhone or iPad. Upload the file to the iCloud account associated with your iPhone or iPad, or transfer it to your device from a computer using Finder (or iTunes, if you have a Windows PC). You can also send it to your iPhone or iPad from another Apple device using AirDrop, but this will send the file directly to your Photos app . Read "How to Save MP4 Files to an iPhone" to learn more about how to transfer MP4 files to your iPhone or iPad. You can also save the files to other cloud-based storage services, such as Google Drive and Dropbox. To access these services from your iPhone or iPad, download the cloud storage app from the App Store, and sign in to the app.

steps.title: Tap the Files app.
steps.content: Tap the Files app. This is the native file manager app that comes with your iPhone or iPad. You might find it on one of your Home Screens or in the App Library. If the file is saved to a different cloud drive, such as Google Drive or Dropbox, tap that app on your Home Screen to access your file. If you have a third-party cloud service synced to Files, you can also access the contents of that cloud service from within Files, under the Locations header in the Browse menu. Check out this guide form Apple to learn more.

steps.title: Tap the Browse tab.
steps.content: Tap the Browse tab. This tab is located at the bottom right side of the screen in the Files app. Tap it to open a menu of locations on your iPhone or iPad. If Browse takes you to a specific location (like your Downloads folder) instead of the main menu, tap Browse in the top left corner of the screen to go back.

steps.title: Tap the location the MP4 is saved to.
steps.content: Tap the location the MP4 is saved to. For example, if it is saved to your iPhone or iPad storage, tap On My iPhone/iPad . If it is saved to your iCloud drive, tap iCloud Drive .

steps.title: Navigate to the MP4 file.
steps.content: Navigate to the MP4 file. If the file is saved to a specific folder, tap that folder to view its contents. Otherwise, scroll up and down to view all the files in the storage drive.

steps.title: Tap the MP4 file.
steps.content: Tap the MP4 file. This opens the file in the standard media player for iPhone and iPad. If your file is stored in iCloud, you may need to wait a moment for it to download to your device before it can play.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . If the video doesn’t start playing automatically, you can start it by tapping the Play icon. This is the triangle shaped button in the center of the video. Tapping it plays the video in full screen mode. If you don’t see the button, tap the center of the video to reveal it. Tap the center of the screen during play to display the pause button and other controls. Drag the timeline at the bottom of the screen to skip to a specific part of the video. From this menu, you can also rotate the video, edit it, share it, or save it to your Photos app.

steps.title: Save the video to Photos.
steps.content: Save the video to Photos. There are several ways to save an MP4 file to Photos on your iPhone or iPad. For example: AirDrop the video to your iPhone or iPad from a Mac or another iOS device to save it directly to Photos. Tap the Download icon next to the video if you got it in a text. If the video is saved somewhere in your Files app (e.g., in your iCloud Drive folder or your Downloads folder), open the video in the Files app , then tap the Share icon below the video. Then, tap Save Video . If you don’t see the video in your main Photos library after using this method, scroll down and check in Recent Days or Recently Saved .

steps.title: Tap the video to open it.
steps.content: Tap the video to open it. Open Photos and navigate to your video, then tap it. If it doesn’t start playing automatically, tap the Play button below the video to start it. Use the controls below the video in the Photos app to skip around in the timeline and turn the sound on or off. From this screen, you can also share, edit, or delete the video.

steps.title: Download VLC from the App Store.
steps.content: Download VLC from the App Store. If you want to watch longer MP4 videos on your iPhone or iPad, you might find it easier to use a third-party media player app. While there are several apps you can use for this, VLC is one of the most popular—and it’s completely free. Other highly rated options include KMPlayer (free) and Infuse (both free and subscription-based versions available).

steps.title: Tap the Network tab.
steps.content: Tap the Network tab. When you first launch VLC on your iPhone or iPad, you’ll see a screen that says “Empty Media Library” when you go to the Video tab. Tap the Network tab at the bottom of the screen to view options for importing and viewing MP4 files.

steps.title: Select the best option for locating your MP4 file.
steps.content: Select the best option for locating your MP4 file. The correct option depends on whether your MP4 file is stored on your iPhone or iPad, or if it’s saved in some other location, such as a cloud service. If the video is saved on your device, tap Local files . This will open the Files app, where you can browse for your video. Tap Cloud Services to open the cloud service where your video is saved (e.g., iCloud or Dropbox). You may need to log in to your selected service. You can also connect to a stream to view a video without downloading it, or use the Downloads option to download the file to your device from a server.

steps.title: Select your file and tap Open.
steps.content: Select your file and tap Open . You can select multiple video files or just one. Once you’ve made your selection, tap Open in the top right corner of the screen. The file will open and begin playing in VLC. Once you open the video, it should begin playing automatically. Tap the screen to open a menu of controls. You can do things like skip around in the timeline, turn on subtitles (if they’re available), and change the aspect ratio of your video. Tap the ••• button to see a list of more advanced options (such as changing the playback speed, adding filters, or adding bookmarks at specific points in the timeline).

steps.title: Tap the file to view it directly in your email or text app.
steps.content: Tap the file to view it directly in your email or text app. If someone sent you an MP4 file over email or text, simply tap on the attachment to start playing it. It will open and play within the app where you received it. This will play the video without downloading it to your Photos app.

steps.title: Use the Download button to save the MP4.
steps.content: Use the Download button to save the MP4. Depending on which app you’re using, the steps for accessing this option may vary slightly. In Apple Mail, you’ll see this button to the right of the video attachment in your message. Tap it to see a menu of options, then browse for a location where you’d like to save the MP4 (e.g., in Files or in iCloud). In Gmail, tap the MP4 to open it, then tap the button at the top of the screen. Open Photos and look for the video in Recent Days or Recently Saved . You can also tap the Share button to open the video in another app, such as VLC Media Player. In the Messages app, tap and hold the video to see a menu of options. Tap Save to save the video to your Photos app.
